reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel for New Year's Eve and I was completely charmed. There was a little mix up when we were told that the restaurant was closed to host a gala ball but when we explained we would want something to eat, we were simply added to the gala ball guestlist at no extra cost! It's in a beautiful location with a stream running by. The bar is absolutely beautiful with a big open fire and lots of dark wood and chandelier lights. The restaurant was fantastic - we especially enjoyed the warm breads offered as a pre-starter. The rooms were lovely, cosy and had the shabby chic that I like in hotels because it gives them an atmosphere lacking in brand-name accommodation. If you, like me, are a fan of manor house hotels (this is a Georgian building transformed into a hotel about ten years ago) and are happy to ignore little things like aged mirrors in the bathroom in the interests of originality then this is the hotel for you.
reviews.title: Georgian charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just home from a weekend stay at the beech hill with a female friend. We were on a girlie weekend away and had a lovely time in the hotel. A lovely country manor with lovely cosy rooms and a real lovely feel to the place. Our room was lovely and spacious. Had dinner on one night and was very tasty. Breakfast was nice..probably not as vast an array of foods as larger hotels but it was adequate. There were 2 weddings on there this weekend but as it was on in the Marque it didnt affect us noisewise at all. Overall a lovely stay, friendly staff and a lovely comfortable room. Would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Belfast. Just outside Derry city and even thougn we had a car we got a taxi to town everytime we went in as only a £5 e/w standard fare.
reviews.title: Lovely restful stay
Great Food & Accomodation
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Beech Hill with my partner for 1 night at the weekend. We arrived in the afternoon and were given a warm welcome by the lady on reception. She showed us to our room and gave us some information about the hotel. We had just settled into our room and got a knock on the door from another member of staff who said that he would like to upgrade us to another room which was not as close to the bar. We duly obliged and follwed him to our new room. The room we were given was a suite and it was superb. It had a living room which was nicely decorated with some paintings etc and sofas and 50" plasma tv. The bedroom was seperate and it was really impressive too. The bed was huge as was the bathroom which had free standing bath and a shower. The bedroom was again tastefully decorated and also had another 50" tv on the wall. The bed was really comfortable and probably the nicest I have ever slept in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked into the restaurant for 6pm on an early evening menu offer. This consisted of 3 courses and tea/coffee for £20 whcih was incredible value in my opinion as the food was delicious. Before our starter came we were offered some freshly baked breads which were delicious. Both my partner and i had tortellini for starter which was stuffed with butternut squash and also had duxelle of mushrooms and parmesan if i remember correctly. The pasta was really fresh and I enjoyed every mouthful.
reviews.title: A Gem of a Hotel - Best service ever experienced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For main course I had salmon which again was really tasty, my partner had chicken which she really enjoyed. The mains were served with creamy mash and fresh veg.
reviews.title: Treated like a President with his First Lady

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Beech Hill Hotel again and it is by far the best hotel we have stayed in. The staff are there for you throughout your stay. As a family run hotel the staff are more like friends when you return and although we stayed during the cold and snow and the water was frozen the staff stayed calm and sorted it all out without any discomfort to the customers. The Hotel is spotless and the food is fantastic I cannot rate this hotel highly enough for couples wanting a break in beautiful quiet surroundings.
reviews.title: Standards never fall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a truely memorable stay. I can't say that too often. Steeped in Irish and American history this hotel is comfortable and elegant but has all the mod cons required. Hearty Irish breakfast served by the owner - now when does that happen in such an establishment? Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great Hotel close to a lovely city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, I agree with the last reviewer and agree Beech Hill would be a 3-star rating. I have neither love nor hate for this hotel, we've stayed here several times now. It's handy for visiting a friend in the nearby city. The hotel is currently undergoing exterior work and one side is fully scaffolded, and unsurprisingly, that's where our latest room was situated. When we entered the room, there was an overwhelming odour of mould and spores ... my other half offered to see if they'd change our room, but I rarely like to be bothered doing that, once you've hauled suitcases up flights of stairs ... it'd need to have a dead rodent before I'd bother ... so we couldn't open the window as I didn't want any more dust/spores in. The room was cold initially, but we whacked the heat up, as usual, then left for several hours ... when we returned, it was like the middle east in June. I yet again berated myself for my stupidity, I've just never been to any hotel anywhere else where guests have such free reign with the temperature - old, cold folks would just love it. On the plus side, the beds are big, and comfy. The bathroom shower-head was quite grotty, otherwise the shower worked fine. Bizarrely, the toiletries on offer were shampoo and bath gel, but no shower gel ... they seemed okay anyway. In the breakfast room, the heat was again stifling ( but this was maybe magnified by our slightly hungover condition ). I'd have loved the menu option, but there were just the usual cereal options. The fruit juices are cheap and not good. The cooked breakfast option seemed to just be the usual fried bread and meats in the heated bain-marie, we weren't offered any alternative this time. I must say, my biggest overall gripe was with the poor quality of the cooked food - I hate paper-thin, scrawny cheap bacon; sawdust sausages and cheap black and white pudding. I wish the owners would cut back on the heat a bit and up the food quality. Cutting corners on food is always a mistake. But I remain ambivalent about the place, believe it or not ! We'll stay here again, possibly in the basement next time ... !!
reviews.title: Not bad, but some problems.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at approx 1 pm and to be honest we didn't expect to get checked in as it was early, however the lady on reception was very friendly and we were shown to our room right away. The room was absolutely freezing when we walked in, we were told they weren't expecting us so early and would switch on the heat right away which she did although it took a couple of hours for it to heat. We went into Londonderry for a few hours and when we came back the room was lovely and warm. We had booked a superior room and it was spacious and nicely decorated and the bathroom was clean and was a good size.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to eat in the hotel as we wanted to enjoy a few drinks so we booked a table in the restaurant. We looked at several different menus and would've liked the early menu which was very reasonably priced however it consisted mostly of fish dishes which was strange as there is usually a dish of beef, chicken and fish available on these type of menus. That was slightly disappointing. However we ate from the set menu and the food and service was absolutely fantastic. We sat in the lovely bar area in big comfy seats in front of the fire which was really relaxing and romantic. There was a wedding on when we were there but this did not affect our stay in any way.
reviews.title: a North of Ireland hidden treasure,, what a discovery!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: arrived very early, about 11, and was given refreshments until our room was ready. Reception could not have been nicer. Room was fantastic and food delicious............
reviews.title: cant wait to go back.................
top quality
reviews.text: Grounds were amazing and beatiful to walk in, and take pictures. Steeped in history too, so very interesting pictures on the walls.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: Excellent value for money, will deffinately go back.
reviews.title: 4th time at this hotel !!! and it only gets better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just returned from the Beechill where my wife and i had an absolutely amazing meal. this place really does pull out all the stops when it comes to food. both our main courses of lamb and cod were cooked to perfection wjth ample portions whilst the freshness of the vegetables was obvious due the flavour. as always the standard of service was second to none with Roy and his colleagues extremely attentive with nothing being too much trouble- if in the area do not miss this place. i most certainly will return for more of the fabulous fare available at the Beechill.
reviews.title: Looking forward to returning for the most relaxing, private, enjoyable experience that we have had in a long time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is the 4th time I have been to this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent service, went out of their way for vegetarian guest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: May be the best you can get in Derry, but really just a 3-star place. The hotel is showing its age and the rooms aren't that large. The furnishings look like they came from my grandparents storage unit. Small bathroom with limited amenities. The staff is friendly and the restaurant is a bargin (relatively speaking). No actual grounds to speak of and they seem to be solely focused on their wedding business. There is self-parking and didn't appear to have a porter to help with luggage. I don't want to give the impression this place is that bad. It was very comfortable and certainly a good place to stay. But compared to more 5-star places in Ireland, you'll notice a difference here.
reviews.title: OK Hotel in Derry area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was lovely and the surrounding grounds lovely. The receptionist was above average. The restaurant service was terrible at dinner and breakfast, but at dinner it was painfully bad. The food was average pub grub only and not what was expected of a hotel.
reviews.title: unfortunately nice place, bad service and food
Fabulous

The staff were friendly, attentive and just couldn't do enough for us making our stay relaxing and wanting to return. The restaurant and choice of menu were superb. Throughly enjoyed the whole experience. We will be back !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel beautiful, Room lovely and Food Fantastic!!
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!

reviews.text: Could not have enjoyed our stay more, the staff were wonderful and incredibly attentive.
reviews.title: Could have been better!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights on a mid-week break in Mid May 2008 specifically for my wifes birthday (and our first visit to the hotel). We both found the hotel, its owners and staff, to be warm and friendly.
reviews.title: Possibly not to everyones taste

likes.liked: — The silence, the food, the friendly staff and the extremely comfortable beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of its popularity, the restaurant does get very busy at night, especially when the hotel is host to a group of diners (and drinkers) who are frequently from the 'movers and shakers' of Northern Ireland. (Bear in mind this where President Clinton stayed, as have many other famous people and it is extremely popular).
reviews.title: bedlam at breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Dinner is a drawn out affair because the high quality food is prepared to order, you shouldn't expect any less at the prices you are paying. The choice of food is varied and will not be to everyones liking because of its distinctly 'gourmet' style, but what is served is excellent, well prepared and extremely well presented. You do need to take the time to study the menu and ask many questions of the staff to be absolutely sure what it is you are ordering, but that's part of the enjoyable pre-dinner routine.
reviews.title: Loved it again

likes.liked: — The general feel of the lovely old house

reviews.title: Avoid the restaurant
reviews.text: A good wine list, at fairly reasonable prices, supports the dining experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds (18 acres) are amazing for a location so close to Derry, although mainly treed with large beech trees (from which the hotel gets its name) there are numerous shrubbed areas, grassed areas, several lakes (one with fish) an old ruin and a water wheel. A stroll around the gravel pathways is pleasant, peacful and rewarding with the quietness only broken by the cawing of rooks.
reviews.title: Not all its cracked up to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have just returned from a very pleasant stay at this lovely country house .I was a guest at a family wedding and I think the hotel was entirely booked out by wedding guests.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and delightful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wedding reception was excellent and almost 200 guests were looked after very well by charming and attentive staff in a marquee a short distance from the main house.
reviews.title: Would I recommend it - certainly not!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our bedroom was well fitted with extremely comfortable beds and the bathroom was spotless.This was a standard room but it was spacious and well lit by two windows which overlooked a gorgeous garden.
reviews.title: Avoid the Weddings!

likes.disliked: — The poor maintenance in our suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our breakfast was first rate.I had juice,lots of fresh fruit, soaked muesli(my favourite),croissants, followed by a cooked mix of mushrooms,bacon, and scrambled eggs.A pot of good quality coffee was replenished when I requested it.The dining room is a lovely sun-filled airy room - we were lucky with the weather !Complimentary newspapers were available for everybody.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — Location, food and restaurant service, room and peacefull and privacy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must add a special word of praise for wonderful Brenda who looked after the desk . My first contact with Brenda had been by email when she promptly answered all my queries.Later she gave me a very interesting history of this lovely house .She was smiling and patient with all of us and is an example of how front of house should be.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The food sold this place to me. Although, the gardens, rooms, staff and charm are also wonderful. Forget about your standardised. boring and characterless hotel rooms. This place has oodles of charm, reflects the changing and erratic history of the building and embraces all that is best to offer in this beautiful area.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great staff and superb food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Whilst I found all to be in good order I would like to highlight, in particular, the wonderful two dinners I had at this hotel.. The roast lamb was simply the best I have ever had. Patsy (owner) explained to me how they source all their meats and vegetables and was very proud to let me know that the animals they use are their own, bred, reared and kept on a farm for the their own use. And she said "you can taste the difference".
reviews.title: An excellent family-run hotel with a friendly and helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am going back. Already booked!!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely country house hotel with such a helpful and friendly staff that it felt just like being at home. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and the food and service of a high standard. I would heartily recommend it to anyone wanting a relaxing break where it is not necessary to leave the hotel and grounds but as it is situated only a few miles from Londonderry centre there is a lot to see and do in the area.
reviews.title: What a Find...Plan to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a fantastic stay at the Beech Hill, thanks to Patsy and her wonderful staff we spent a very special 2 days there to celebrate my Mum and Dads golden wedding anniversary, we had afternoon tea when we arrived with freshly baked scones, sandwiches, and pastries which were all delicious, dinner and breakfast were equally delicious, the salmon and rib eye steak which my husband and i had for dinner were so good and the breakfast with the choice of cereal, toast, porridge, fresh fruit or a full irish breakfast was all so tasty.
reviews.title: A great find..we'll return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Beech Hill to celebrate our 37th wedding anniversary and had a great time. We booked through the website and had not stayed here before - but we do intend to return. We were welcomed warmly and shown to a spacious room overlooking the gardens. During the night there was a problem with the fan in the bathroom and next day we were moved to a fabulous suite. We were impressed by the way our complaint about the fan was handled. Not a problem - it would be dealt with and in the meantime we were transferred to the other accomodation.
reviews.title: Lovely Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was wonderful - beautiful to look at and so tasty and full of flavour. Restaurant staff were friendly, helpful and very efficient as were all of the other members of hotel staff we encountered during our stay.
reviews.title: Ohh Dear Ohh Dear

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was so good to find a place where the customer was considered important and we can't wait to return. We will certainly recommend Beech Hill House to all our friends. A little known gem!
reviews.title: It was wonderful!
